CrazyChess.logic

Class MainLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • CrazyChess.logic.MainLogic

  • public class MainLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class for the chess game logic. Ties everything to do with logic together.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainLogic

        public MainLogic()
        Constructor for the MainLogic class. Initiates the gamestate as an empty board. Initiates currentTurn with "white" Initiates turnNo with 1

        Getter for debug mode.
        Returns:
        true if debug mode is on, false if not

      • getCheckStatus

        public boolean getCheckStatus(java.lang.String color)
        Method used to see if a player of specified color in currently under check
        Parameters:
        color - color of the player to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified player is in check, false if not

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • changeTurn

        public void changeTurn()
        Changes the turn to the opposite of what it currently is. If for some reason the turn is neither Black nor White by default the method sets it to white

      • switchTurn

        public void switchTurn()
        Switches the turn to the opposite of what it currently is, but does not increase the number of turns. Used for the "ask for draw" button. If for some reason the turn is neither Black nor White by default the method sets it to white

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Places all pieces in proper starting position

      • move

        protected boolean move(AbstractPiece p,
                       int xRel,
                       int yRel)
        This method defines a move. Takes all of the rules and restrictions into consideration. Moves a piece x squares right/left and y squares up/down. Further used in function moveTo
        Parameters:
        p - the piece selected to be moved
        xRel - how far left or right to move
        yRel - how far up or down to move
        Returns:
        true if move was successful, false if not

      • moveTo

        public boolean moveTo(AbstractPiece p,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Attempts to move a piece to the set parameters. Returns true if success.
        Parameters:
        p - the piece selected to be moved
        x - x position to attempt to move to
        y - y position to attempt to move to
        Returns:
        true if move was successful, false if not

      • getPiece

        public AbstractPiece getPiece(Position pos)
        Basically just a neat little wrapper for getPiece method in CrazyChess.logic.Utilities
        Parameters:
        pos - target position
        Returns:
        The piece in the specified position

      • printGameState

        public void printGameState()
        Just a wrapper for the printGameState method in the Utilities class

      • getTurnNo

        public int getTurnNo()
        Gives you the current turn number
        Returns:
        current turn number

      • usePowerup

        public boolean usePowerup(int powerupIndex,
                          Position target1,
                          Position target2)
        Method for using powerups. Returns true if the use of the powerup process was successful, false if not. If using a powerup was successful, it will also alter the current gamestate.
        Parameters:
        powerupIndex - index (in whitePowerUps or blackPowerUps) of the powerup to be used
        target1 - position of the first piece to be used in the powerup
        target2 - position of the second piece to be used in the powerup (can be NULL)
        Returns:
        true if the use of the powerup process was successful, false if not

      • getPowerUps

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPowerUps(java.lang.String player)
        Gives you powerups of the desired player
        Parameters:
        player - color of the desired player
        Returns:
        ArrayList of powerups that the player has

      • resetWBombsound

        public void resetWBombsound()
        Resets the white bomb sound (sets WB back to 0) .

      • resetBBombsound

        public void resetBBombsound()
        Resets the black bomb sound (sets BB back to 0) .

      • getWB

        public int getWB()
        Gets the value for WB. The value is used to check if a bomb explosion sound is supposed to be played for white.
        Returns:
        value of WB (1 if the sound is supposed to be played, 0 if not)

      • getBB

        public int getBB()
        Gets the value for BB. The value is used to check if a bomb explosion sound is supposed to be played for black.
        Returns:
        value of BB (1 if the sound is supposed to be played, 0 if not)

        Returns:

      • isPawnPromote

        public AbstractPiece isPawnPromote(AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        This takes a gamestate and tell the player if a pawn promotion is available
        Parameters:
        gamestate - the gamestate to check
        Returns:
        the pawn for promotion or null if none exists

      • promote

        public void promote(AbstractPiece piece,
                    java.lang.String newPiece)
        Promotes a pawn. newPice is 'q', 'k', 'r,' b', for queen, king, rook, bishop respectively
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to promote
        newPiece - the type of piece to promote to
